metadata.title: CVE-2012-6612 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The (1) UpdateRequestHandler for XSLT or (2) XPathEntityProcessor in ApacheSolr before 4.1 allows remote attackers to have an unspecified impact viaXML data containing an external entity declaration in conjunction with anentity reference, related to an XML External Entity (XXE) issue, differentvectors than CVE-2013-6407.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblucene3-contrib-java - 3.6.2+dfsg-2
liblucene3-java - 3.6.2+dfsg-2
libsolr-java - 3.6.2+dfsg-2
solr-common - 3.6.2+dfsg-2
solr-jetty - 3.6.2+dfsg-2
solr-tomcat - 3.6.2+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lucene-solr package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.2+dfsg-2').
